main event: A circular or elliptical object was observed by a civilian in Sidney, Ohio on September 8, 1961.
interesting points: The object appeared to be moving around, changing color and size.
The object was observed for 6 to 10 seconds, coasting from southwest to southeast.
The object was brighter than the brightest stars.
The witness was not sure if the object stood still, suddenly sped up, broke up, gave off smoke, changed brightness, changed color, flashed or flickered, or disappeared and reappeared.
The object had a bright white, brilliant whitish color.
